newsitem.title: GREECE: Greece to issue 4pct, CPI-indexed bonds May 19-min.
newsitem.headline: Greece to issue 4pct, CPI-indexed bonds May 19-min.

text.p: Greece will issue 4.0 percent, five- and 10-year coupon and principal CPI-indexed bonds on May 19 and plans to auction about 150 billion drachmas of 10-year fixed coupon bonds in mid-June, said deputy Finance Minister Nickos Christodoulakis.

"Greece will issue five and 10-year consumer price indexed bonds featuring a coupon of 4.0 percent on May 19," Christodoulakis told reporters. "Our annual target is about 300 billion drachmas for the year."

Asked whether the ministry will consider auctioning or issuing indexed bonds again in 1997 if the treasury raised more than 300 billion on May 19, Christodoulakis said the ministry would auction indexed bonds by the end of 1997.
He declined to disclose the selling commission for indexed bonds but added that the commission would be determined later on as the issue date got closer.
